content: ☕🍥 🍩🍪 coffee time cozy designed by amber johnson starry whisper weaves difficulty level confident beginner intermediate you should be comfortable with basic stitches shaping and simple assembly including layering and embroidery details 1 ✂ materials 4 🪡stitches & abbreviations 5 🪡special stitches 5 📏 gauge 6 🌟 pattern notes 7 🌟 pattern 8 ☕cups 8 🧡heart cookie 11 🍥cinnamon roll 12 🍥 icing 13 🍩donut 15 🍩 icing 15 🔤letters 16 ✏ c 16 ✏ o 16 ✏ t 17 ✏ i 17 ✏ m 17 ✏ f make 2 18 ✏ e make 3 18 ⬜background 20 🎉 congratulations 22 🧶 find more great patterns 💛 22 📱 contact and connect 💛 22 printer-friendly version 23 2 this pattern is for personal use only please do not distribute share or sell the pattern itself instead kindly direct others to my official platforms you are welcome to sell finished products made using this pattern i d appreciate design credit 💛 ✂ materials yarn worsted weight yardage is approximate total = 258 yds ● color a off white 120 yds ● color b brown 50 yds ● color c teal 24 yds ● color d yellow 24 yds ● color e light brown 18 yds ● color f orange 8 yds ● color g pink 7 yds ● color h white 7 yds crochet hook us g6 4 00 mm yarn needle for sewing pieces together weaving in ends and embroidery pins optional for holding pieces in place before sewing stitch markers optional to keep track of rounds scissors 3 🪡 stitches & abbreviations ● chain = chain ● single_crochet = single_crochet ● double_crochet = double_crochet ● treble_crochet = triple crochet ● increase = 2 single_crochet in the same stitch ● double_crochet increase = 2 double_crochet in the same stitch ● decrease = single_crochet 2 stitches together aka decrease ● slip_stitch = slip_stitch ● fo = fasten_off 🪡 special stitches 3-stitch decrease ● insert hook into first st yo pull up a loop 2 loops on hook ● skip next st insert hook into third st yo pull up a loop 3 loops on hook ● yo pull through all 3 loops 4 running stitch ● thread the yarn tail onto a yarn needle ● insert the needle from front to back through both the motif and the base ● move forward one stitch space then bring the needle back up through both layers ● repeat around the motif until it s fully secured 📏 gauge 15 single_crochet and 15 row = 4 inches finished size 13 5 long and 12 wide 5 🌟 pattern notes ● this pattern is worked by creating multiple appliqués and attaching them to a project of your choice such as a pillow blanket tote bag and more ● i ve included the background instructions i personally used but you re encouraged to get creative and make this your own ● feel free to change up the colors to suit your preferences or match your
